desc: NOTCH3 encodes a Type I transmembrane protein of the Notch family that functions as receptor for Jagged1/2, and Delta 1, and regulates cell-fate determination through the NOTCH signaling pathway. Missense and nonsense mutations in NOTCH3 in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, breast, colorectal, melanoma, glioblastoma, liver, lung, ovarian, and prostate have been identified. NOTCH3 overexpression correlates with better overall survival in ovarian cancer.

NOTCH3 encodes a Type I transmembrane protein of the Notch family that functions as receptor for Jagged1/2, and Delta 1, and play a key role in cellular signaling and regulates cell-fate determination through the NOTCH signaling pathway (PMID: 19165418). NOTCH3 mutations were initially identified in cerebral autosomal dominant arteriopathy with subcortical infarcts and leukoencephalopathy (CADASIL) (PMID: 26715087). Expression studies have also shown elevated NOTCH3 expression during cellular senescence and loss-of-function mutations that interrupt senescence are identified in several types of cancer including head and neck carcinoma, breast, colorectal, melanoma, glioblastoma,liver, lung, ovarian, and prostate cancer. (PMID: 23610446) In a recent study of NOTCH3 expression in ovarian cancer, overexpression of NOTCH3 associated with better overall survival (PMID: 26662955).

articles.title: Notch3 functions as a tumor suppressor by controlling cellular senescence.
articles.reference: Cui H et al. Cancer research. 2013 Jun 1;73(11)3451-9.
